member.summary: Adds a build configuration to m_PreconfiguredBuilds

member.name: M:XKEditorTools.XKET.InitializePreconfiguredBuilds
member.summary: Method initializing all build configurations For any change in this function, there should be a similar change in BuilderCategory.InitAllPlatforms(). For exemple, if we were to add the configuration for XBox One, we should add the following lines : In InitializePreconfiguredBuilds() : AddBuild(BuildTarget.XboxOne, EBuildOptions.Dev | EBuildOptions.Script, "XboxOne"); In BuilderCategory.InitAllPlatforms() : InitPlatform("Consoles", "XBoxOne", BuildTarget.XboxOne);

member.name: M:XKEditorTools.XKET.AlignOnY
member.summary: Align all the selected transforms on y axis (all the selected elements will have the same x position)

member.name: M:XKEditorTools.BuilderCategory.InitAllPlatforms
member.summary: Initialises the build platforms and categories. For any changes to this function, there should be a similar change in XKET.InitializePreconfiguredBuilds(). (In file XKET_Builder.cs) For exemple, if we were to add the configuration for XBox One, we should add the following lines : In InitAllPlatforms() : InitPlatform("Consoles", "XBoxOne", BuildTarget.XboxOne); In XKET.InitializePreconfiguredBuilds() : AddBuild(BuildTarget.XboxOne, XKET.EBuildOptions.Dev | XKET.EBuildOptions.Script, "XboxOne");

member.name: T:XKEditorTools.Drawing
member.summary: Class from http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/71979-Drawing-lines-in-the-editor

member.name: M:XKEditorTools.GuiBuilder.GetArea(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get the index-th horizontal slice of the screen if we assume that it is split into 'count' parts example:
Screen +---------------+---------------+---------------+ | | | | | GetArea(0, 3) | GetArea(1, 3) | GetArea(2, 3) | | | | | +---------------+---------------+---------------+
`span` can be used to merge several areas. For exemple, an area starting on index 2 with a `span` value of 2 will be twice larger than a normal area and the next free spot will be the area at index 4 (and not 3).
